Description: Triggers actions with a text label and optional leading/trailing icon.
The functional primitive for all icon-only interactive triggers.
A link-wrapped social icon (Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.).
Global Controller: Toggles automated motion, autoplay, or GIF playback for a section, grid, or modal.
Item Controller: Stateful button (Play/Pause/Replay). Includes a "Progress" variant with a loading ring for GIFs/Reels and 'Standard' variant for audios (no loading ring).
A stateful icon (Speaker) used to toggle audio on or off for specific media items.
A functional icon or labeled button (e.g., "Show more +") that initiates a modal overlay.
An "Expand" icon-button that initiates the full-screen immersive video experience..
A stateful button that calls the navigator.share() API.
An icon-button used to trigger the browser's download prompt for the raw media file.
A subtle visual divider (dot or pipe) between meta-values ("‚Ä¢").
A full-width or container-width horizontal/vertical vector line. Used to create clear visual boundaries between sections.
Single UI icon with size, color, and accessibility constraints.
Best for micro-interactions and buffering states within an active frame.
Status Indicator: A numerical value used across the system to show quantity or overflow. Used as (n) for counts or +X for hidden tags.
Manages image cropping and sizing for team photos.
A lightweight "hyperlink" style navigation element without a background container, often featuring a trailing arrow or underline.
Specialized nav link for the Breadcrumb trail.
A specialized navigation link supporting specific typography, active/hover states, and spacing rules for the header.
The raw brand asset. Can be configured as a "Link to Home" (Brand) or an "External Link" (Partner).
The technical "primitive." It contains the logic for focus trapping, scroll prevention, and z-index management.
Typography primitive governed by semantic intent and design tokens.
Primary semantic title text.
Variant for small, uppercase category labels.
Use for introductory text directly under a heading.
Standard body and description text.
Stylized editorial text used for personal statements.
A text-based identifier used to categorize or "key" a specific piece of data.
Interactive text that floats to the border upon interaction.
Typography variant for captions and legal notes.
Action Text: The core text string for interactive components like buttons and triggers.
Represents the raw data entry area (HTML <input> or <textarea>). It governs the typography of user-entered strings and manages interactive states such as Focus, Active, Disabled, and Error styling.
Feedback: Small-scale text for errors or instructions.
Minimal-scale text for terms or privacy policies.
Secondary Data: Neutral text for reading time and dates (e.g., "5-minute read", "July 26, 2026").
Attribution Text: Bold identifier for content creators, often interactive.
A data visualization primitive combining a large serif value and a sans-serif descriptor.
Global typography lockup for Name and Role, ensuring consistent hierarchy across all person-related molecules.
Compact Label: Represents a single category or topic.
Interactive title row with disclosure trigger.
Wrapper for a single collapsible unit.
Container managing a vertical list of AccordionItems.
Dual-behavior unit revealing complex content inline/drawer.
Global notification strip for site status or criticall alerts.
Manages navigation, expansion, and motion playback states.
Navigation cluster consisting of arrows and pagination dots.
Specialized CTA triggering the mobile FilterSheet with active counts.
Dynamic list managing tags with overflow (+X) logic.
Label and social actions sharing pattern.
Contextual bar for AI tools (Summarize, Listen, Share).
Base layout engine (padding, radius, vertical structure).
Work/project-specific card with media and metadata.
News/article card with category tags and dates.
Portrait card; toggles Quote or Bio to preserve grid height.
Boxed variant of contact block with a background.
Media-focused card used to trigger informational modals.
Core carousel behavior (motion, accessibility).
Horizontal layout and "peek" behavior for card arrays.
Adapts carousel engine for text/quote blocks.
Standardized track for raw media assets.
Data entry unit: Supports floating labels, clear actions, and validation feedback states.
Uncontained editorial assembly for inline CTAs.
Physical address details and communication triggers.

Dependency: Overline, Heading, Subtitle, Description, Quote, LinkGroup
Description: A polymorphic text orchestrator governing the stack of Overline, Heading, Subtitle, Description and LinkGroup.
A standalone molecule for quotes, featuring large typography and specific attribution slots.
Manages the distribution and responsive behavior of multiple StatItem atoms.
Manages text truncation with a transparent mask and a "Show more" toggle.
A governed composition of a Heading and optional actions/descriptions.
Orchestrates category titles and lists of FilterItems.
Individual row/checkbox within the sheet.
Container governing alignment of multiple Logo atoms.
Layout utility for stacking items with consistent gaps.
Supports bullets/icons; acts as a navigational trigger.
High-impact pairing of visual assets with narrative text.
Designed for project metadata or technical specs.
Structural container hosting various formats and interaction tools.
Standardized grouping of playback and expansion triggers.
Hierarchical trail enforcing accessibility; on mobile, it functions as a "Back" button.
Compact mobile-only grid for the broader agency ecosystem..
Horizontal grouping of Link atoms with governed spacing.
Simple text link (e.g., "Fr") pinned to footer or mobile drawer.
Attribution and timestamps for long-form content.
A versatile CTA unit supporting centered, side-image, or triple-zone background configurations.
Section-level carousel showcasing project cards with integrated controls.
Section-level carousel showcasing article/news cards with integrated controls.
Section-level carousel showcasing expert cards with header and manual controls.
A specialized section orchestrating mixed content (e.g., News and Work together).
Implementation of CarouselMedia optimized for 9:16 vertical video and autoplay.
Mobile-exclusive bottom sheet for grid filtering;
Desktop-exclusive horizontal assembly used to refine content grids.
A layout shell managing column counts and gap spacing for any card array .
The top-level wrapper for listing pages; manages the grid state, filtering, and pagination.
Primary unit for landing pages; introduces a topic via structured text and a visual asset.

Dependency: Section (base), Breadcrumb, ArticleMeta, TagGroup, ContentBlock, MediaContainer
Description: The master editorial header establishing context, authorship, and taxonomy .
A dedicated implementation for immersive, full-screen video playback.
ButtonIconThe global site header combining brand identity, primary navigation, and utility triggers (Search/AI) .
Governing assembly for site links. Manages horizontal desktop layout and the mobile menu toggle interaction.
Mobile menu overlay; manages the transition from hamburger icon to a full-screen menu .
A side-sliding organism used to explore deep service details without leaving the current page.
High-level shell providing a header slot and a main content slot for other organisms.
Immersive person profile layout (portrait + bio/quote).
A multi-column grid organism used to showcase an expanded collection of project media and case study details.
The Base Layout Engine: Manages vertical padding tokens ($S, M, L$) and supports Single Column or Vertical Split variants.
A full-width page section designed to showcase a curated gallery of images, videos, or GIFs with associated captions.
A narrative-driven section used in long-form content to introduce a carousel of cards with deep editorial context.
Specifically designed to showcase impact data and metrics alongside context.
A configuration of Section that pairs a ContentBlock with a CarouselQuote molecule.
Pairs a CTA headline with a PersonContactBlock or CardPerson.
Pairs editorial introduction text with a collapsible Accordion structure.
A full-page section combining a ContentBlock (Title, Desc, CTAs) with a CollectionGrid of 1 to 4 columns.
A "sticky" dual-zone layout where media stays pinned while content blocks scroll vertically.
Scroll-driven "spotlight" section; ListItems transition from dimmed to full-contrast during scroll .
Functions as an accordion on desktop and triggers a ServiceDrawer modal on mobile for focused deep-dives.
